title: PSLV fails for 2nd time in 9 months; 3rd-stage glitch costs 16 satellites
content: India's first space mission of 2026, carrying 16 satellites including a crucial DRDO military satellite, failed due to a glitch in the PSLV's third stage. This marks the first consecutive failure for the PSLV, impacting strategic, diplomatic, and commercial projects, including a satellite refueling technology demonstrator.

title: 'Take them to your house': SC questions dog feeding groups; compensation warning for states
content: The Supreme Court warned states of heavy compensation for inaction on stray dog bites, particularly affecting children and the elderly. The bench also demanded accountability from dog feeders, suggesting they house the animals. The court emphasized its focus on Animal Birth Control rules and flagged non-compliance by civic bodies, leading to deaths from bites and accidents.

title: $20m gold heist in Canada: One arrested, another suspect 'believed to be in India'
content: A man wanted in connection with the massive 2023 Pearson Airport gold heist was arrested upon arriving from Dubai. Arsalan Chaudhary faces multiple charges related to the theft of over $20 million in gold and cash. Police continue to hunt for other suspects, including one believed to be in India.

title: Brics India 2026 logo launched; lotus takes centrestage — key details and theme
content: India has launched its logo and official website for the Brics Presidency 2026, with External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar outlining key priorities. The nation aims to foster global welfare through resilience, innovation, cooperation, and sustainability across Brics' political, economic, and cultural pillars. The logo, inspired by the lotus, symbolizes unity among member nations

title: Section 17A of Prevention of Corruption Act: SC delivers split verdict; what the two judges said
content: The Supreme Court delivered a split verdict on Section 17A of the Prevention of Corruption Act, which requires prior approval to probe government officials. Justice Nagarathna deemed it unconstitutional, arguing it protects the corrupt, while Justice Viswanathan upheld its validity, provided Lokpal/Lokayukta grants sanction, to prevent policy paralysis.

title: Google founders 'dump' California: Move echoes Jeff Bezos’ exit; why tech billionaires are leaving
content: Google co-founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin are reportedly leaving California, mirroring Jeff Bezos's move to Miami. This exodus, involving significant property purchases, is seen by analysts as a strategic shift, potentially driven by tax considerations. California's proposed billionaire's tax on assets adds to the allure of tax-friendly states like Florida.

title: 'Wrong call': Gautam Gambhir criticised for sending injured Washington Sundar to bat
content: Washington Sundar's decision to bat with a visible injury in the first ODI against New Zealand has sparked debate. Former cricketer Mohammad Kaif criticised the team management's handling, citing a double standard compared to Shubman Gill's injury management. Kaif argued that sending an injured Sundar risked aggravating his injury unnecessarily.

title: Happy Lohri 2026: Top wishes to share with your loved ones
content: Lohri 2026, on January 13th, celebrates the end of winter with bonfires, songs, and traditional delicacies, honoring harvest and longer days. This vibrant festival in northern India, especially Punjab, signifies gratitude, hard work, and intergenerational togetherness, marking the Sun's Capricorn entry and ushering in prosperity.

title: From Marvel to municipal: Thanos, Tony Stark, Hulk jump into Maharashtra civic polls
content: AI-generated fictional characters from global pop culture are entering ward-level politics in Pune through satire accounts. These characters, speaking fluent Marathi and adopting local anxieties, offer relatable election season entertainment, with videos garnering millions of views and widespread sharing.

title: Musk slams Apple-Google deal: Unreasonable power grab; xAI CEO warns of monopoly
content: Tech billionaire Elon Musk has slammed Apple and Google's new AI collaboration, calling it an "unreasonable concentration of power" for Google. Musk, whose xAI company competes with Google's Gemini, voiced concerns that this deal could stifle rivals. While markets cheered the partnership, with Alphabet briefly surpassing Apple in valuation, Musk's objections hint at potential future challenges.

title: Winter shock in Gurgaon: Frosted roofs, frozen windscreens mark coldest morning
content: Gurgaon experienced its coldest morning of the season with temperatures plummeting to 2.7°C, leading to frost in many areas. The cold spell is expected to persist for several days, with outskirts potentially dipping to sub-zero temperatures. IMD has issued warnings for dense fog and its impact on travel and health.

title: ‘Paper tigers’: Sunil Gavaskar unloads on England and Bazball
content: Sunil Gavaskar has heavily criticised Ben Stokes' England following their 4-1 Ashes series defeat in Australia, labeling them "paper tigers." He argued that the Bazball approach has lost its effectiveness, with teams now able to counter England's aggressive style, especially on challenging pitches. Gavaskar also pointed to a lack of accountability in the English batting lineup.

title: Streaming wars: Paramount CEO to WBD shareholders; flags gaps in Netflix deal valuation
content: Paramount CEO David Ellison is aggressively opposing Netflix's acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD). Ellison has filed a lawsuit and sent a letter to WBD shareholders, arguing that Paramount's all-cash offer is superior and that WBD is withholding crucial financial details. He claims shareholders cannot fairly evaluate offers without this transparency.

title: UAE issues weather alert as dense fog causes traffic delays
content: UAE commuters faced a foggy and congested Tuesday morning. Abu Dhabi experienced dangerously low visibility due to dense fog, while Sharjah and Dubai saw significant traffic jams on key highways. Authorities urged drivers to exercise extreme caution, maintain safe distances, and use appropriate headlights. The fog is expected to dissipate by noon, leading to a clearer afternoon.

title: 'Stop deceitful actions': Khamenei warns US politicians amid Trump's threats to Iran — key points
content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei issued a stern warning to the US, accusing it of deceitful actions and relying on 'hirelings' amid escalating tensions. President Trump's support for anti-regime protesters and a new 25% tariff on countries trading with Iran have intensified the standoff.  Senator Lindsey Graham responded sarcastically to Khamenei's remarks.

title: Delhi freezes: Temperature dips to 3°C, dense fog persists; AQI remains ‘very poor’
content: Delhi experienced a frigid Tuesday morning, with temperatures dropping to a biting 3°C amidst a persistent cold wave and dense fog. The city's air quality remained a significant concern, with the overall Air Quality Index (AQI) registering in the 'very poor' category. Several localities recorded AQI levels exceeding 300, highlighting the severe pollution levels.

title: Trump’s fresh blow: 25% tariffs on countries trading with Iran - what does it mean for India?
content: Donald Trump has announced immediate 25% tariffs on countries trading with Iran. What does this decision mean for India’s imports and exports with Iran?

title: UP horror: Man shoots wife dead inside police station
content: A shocking incident unfolded at a police station in Hardoi where a man shot his wife dead. The victim had reportedly eloped with her lover days prior. The husband, Anoop, arrived at the station and fatally shot Soni in front of officers. Two cops have been suspended following this severe security lapse.

title: Coach assault case: NRAI assures female shooters of safety
content: A recent alleged assault on a minor shooter by a national coach has prompted the NRAI to reaffirm its commitment to athlete safety. President Kalikesh Narayan Singh Deo assured female shooters of a secure environment, promising stricter SOPs and swift action against any wrongdoers. The federation has suspended the accused coach pending investigation.

title: Brampton auto theft network: Three Indian-origin residents arrested with stolen vehicles
content: Three individuals of Indian origin have been apprehended in Brampton as part of a significant auto theft and fraud investigation. Authorities recovered three stolen vehicles, with charges ranging from possession of stolen property to attempted vehicle theft and break-ins. Two of the accused were already under release orders for prior property offenses.

title: Clemson professor fired over Charlie Kirk post reaches settlement
content: Clemson University professor Dr. Joshua Bregy has settled with the university after his September 2025 termination over a social media post about Charlie Kirk.  Under the agreement, Bregy will remain employed with benefits until May 15, 2026, without teaching duties, and will receive letters of recommendation. The ACLU of South Carolina hailed the settlement as a win for academic freedom.

title: 'Leave Iran now': US warns its citizens as tensions rise; over 600 killed in protests — key details
content: The US has issued an urgent advisory for citizens to leave Iran immediately due to escalating protests that may turn violent, leading to arrests and disruptions. Airlines are limiting flights, and the embassy advises departing by land to Armenia or Turkey. Dual nationals face significant risks, being treated solely as Iranian citizens.

title: Man murders girlfriend in Ghaziabad hotel, sleeps next to her corpse
content: A 34-year-old labourer allegedly killed his girlfriend in a Ghaziabad hotel after an argument, then slept beside her body. He called the police the next morning, claiming she was unwell. Autopsy revealed severe internal injuries from a brutal assault, leading to his arrest for murder.

title: Virat Kohli's pre-batting routine goes viral - video
content: Virat Kohli's sublime form continued as he scored a fluent 93 in the first ODI, helping India chase down 301. During his knock, he became the fastest to 28,000 international runs and moved to second on the all-time list. A viral video also captured his quick pre-batting routine.

title: Pro-Palestinian protest at Stanford leads to felony trial for five students: Here’s what to know
content: A jury trial has commenced for five Stanford University students charged in connection with a pro-Palestinian protest that occupied the university president's offices. Prosecutors allege significant property damage, while the defense asserts the defendants are exercising their right to a jury trial. This case is a rare instance of demonstrators facing trial amid a broader wave of campus protests.

title: UP couple who eloped and married lured back home, thrashed and killed in public
content: A 19-year-old girl and her 23-year-old husband, who eloped and married last month, were brutally murdered by the woman's family in Uttar Pradesh. The couple was thrashed and had their throats slit in front of shocked bystanders. Three family members have been arrested, while two others are on the run.

title: History beckons: Shreyas Iyer on the brink of a massive milestone
content: Shreyas Iyer is on the cusp of a significant ODI milestone, needing just 34 runs to reach 3000. His recent 49 in the first ODI against New Zealand showcased his return to form after injury. Iyer has become a vital middle-order batsman, consistently performing for India since his 2017 debut.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 25,850; BSE Sensex up over 250 points
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmarks, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in green on Tuesday. While Nifty50 was above 25,850, BSE Sensex was up over 250 points.

title: Disha Patani dating Talwinder? Rumoured couple spotted holding hands
content: Disha Patani's masked companion has seemingly been identified as Punjabi singer Talwinder Singh Sidhu at a recent wedding. Videos show the actress holding hands with the singer, sans his usual face covering, sparking dating rumors. This sighting follows previous instances of them being seen together, adding to ongoing speculation about Patani's personal life.

title: Virat Kohli spots his lookalike; what he said to Rohit Sharma
content: A young fan, nicknamed 'Mini Virat' for his striking resemblance to the Indian batting icon, had a memorable encounter with Virat Kohli during a training session. Kohli paused to acknowledge the boy, posing for pictures and sharing laughs, an interaction that quickly went viral online. The youngster revealed Kohli playfully pointed him out to Rohit Sharma, calling him 'Chhota Chiku'.

title: Applying online alone won’t get you hired in 2026: Here’s what actually works
content: As 2026 approaches, job seekers are growing disillusioned with online applications that feel automated and unresponsive. Glassdoor data shows widespread pessimism, yet also reveals a way forward. Referrals, recruiter outreach and strategic networking significantly improve hiring outcomes, suggesting that visibility, human connections and targeted effort matter more than mass applications.

title: First Russia, now Iran: Trump announces 25% tariffs on Tehran's trade partners; calls order 'final'
content: US President Donald Trump has imposed a 25% tariff on nations trading with Iran, escalating pressure over Tehran's violent crackdown on protests. Trump warned of severe retaliation if Iran strikes US bases, stating the nation is nearing a red line.

title: Indian-origin gynecologist found guilty of medical malpractice in US
content: Memphis gynecologic oncologist Dr Sanjeev Kumar faces conviction on multiple counts, including medical device adulteration and healthcare fraud. Prosecutors allege he performed unnecessary procedures using improperly reprocessed single-use devices on thousands of patients, billing millions to Medicare and Medicaid. Dr Kumar maintains his innocence, asserting his disinfection methods were scientific.

title: Bengaluru dental student dies by suicide; kin allege colour-based harassment
content: A dental student's mother has accused six lecturers of abetting her daughter's suicide, alleging persistent harassment over lateness, dressing, and appearance. Despite a suicide note claiming self-responsibility, the mother insists her daughter faced continuous humiliation, including being insulted publicly and questioned about her suitability for medicine. Police have registered a case based on the complaint.

title: Canadian influencer living in India slams 'videshi' tags for Indian cities
content: A Canadian influencer's viral video highlights India's unique identity, urging an end to comparing its places to foreign counterparts. He argues such labels diminish India's originality, from Bengaluru's 'Silicon Valley' tag to regional film industries. The sentiment resonates deeply, sparking conversations about self-pride and valuing India's inherent brilliance.

title: Hidden sugars in 'healthy' foods: How to read food labels like a nutrition expert
content: Many "healthy" foods contain hidden sugars that can negatively impact health, leading to risks of diabetes and obesity. Experts advise scrutinizing ingredient lists for various sugar names and understanding the difference between total and added sugars. Making gradual dietary changes and focusing on whole foods are key to reducing sugar intake without feeling deprived.

title: Lauren Kyle applauds Leon Draisaitl’s latest Oilers achievement
content: Edmonton Oilers star Leon Draisaitl achieved a remarkable 1,000 NHL points, a milestone celebrated with his family and teammates. Despite a recent shootout loss, Draisaitl's historic achievement, coupled with his two-goal performance, provided a significant spark for the team.  Connor McDavid also extended his impressive point streak, highlighting individual brilliance amidst team aspirations.

title: Top stocks to buy or sell today: Stock market recommendations for Jan 13 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Somil Mehta of Mirae Asset Sharekhan recommends selling Computer Age Management Services (CAMS), and Naukri (Info Edge India Ltd). He recommends buying Hindustan Zinc. Let’s take a look:

title: Vanessa and Natalia Bryant’s combined net worth after Kobe Bryant
content: Vanessa and Natalia Bryant, following the tragic loss of Kobe Bryant, have amassed a combined net worth of $606 million. Vanessa manages the Mamba & Mambacita Sports Foundation and benefits from brand deals and business ventures. Natalia, a budding model, contributes to her $6 million net worth through her career and inheritance.

title: Donna Kelce admits Travis Kelce–Taylor Swift wedding planning isn’t easy
content: Donna Kelce is reportedly finding it difficult to stay on the sidelines as her son Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift plan their wedding. While she has many ideas and loves wedding details, insiders say she is consciously holding back to avoid overstepping. Despite the challenge, she shares a strong, positive relationship with Swift and supports the couple’s choices.

title: Supreme Court on SIR hearing LIVE: SC set to hear pleas challenging ECI’s SIR decision
content: Earlier, ECI had told the Bench that it has the power and competence to undertake SIR of the electoral rolls, besides, there is a constitutional duty to ensure that no foreigners are registered as voters.

title: Uttar Pradesh Gangsters Act case: Supreme Court makes interim bail absolute for MLA Abbas Ansari
content: A Bench headed by Chief Justice of India Surya Kant directed him to inform the police before leaving Uttar Pradesh

title: UDF wins Vizhinjam local body poll in Kerala, wrests control from LDF after a decade
content: K.H. Sudheer Khan wins by a margin of 83 votes. UDF victory comes as a blow for BJP, which nurtured hopes of securing a majority in Thiruvananthapuram Corporation on its own by winning Vizhinjam ward

title: Republic Day 2026: How to get free passes for full dress parade rehearsal?
content: The free passes for Full Dress Rehearsal of the Republic Day 2026 would be live soon. Check for more details

title: Nipah virus detected in West Bengal: know about the virus and its symptoms
content: According to the WHO, the Nipah virus infection is a zoonosis, that is, a disease transmitted from animals to humans.

title: Wayanad rehabilitation: CPI(M) accuses Congress of lack of transparency in fund use
content: Minister M.B. Rajesh says Opposition Leader V.D. Satheesan is ‘tying himself in knots trying to explain the lack of transparency’ in use of significant funds collected by Congress from public in the name of Wayanad landslide rehabilitation

title: Supreme Court differs on whether prior sanction a must for prosecution of government officials
content: The judgment was based on a petition filed by the NGO, Centre for Public Interest Litigation,  represented by advocate Prashant Bhushan, challenging Section 17A

title: Centre waived ₹5.23 crore payable by Mizoram Government for vacated Assam Rifles facilities: CM Lalduhoma
content: Mizoram CM Lalduhoma said he had written to the Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Nitiyanand Rai in May last year, urging him to waive the sum

title: Inter-departmental panel formed to combat 'digital arrests' on real-time basis, met with online intermediaries: Government to Supreme Court
content: A note given by the Union government in the Supreme Court showed that ₹3000 crore has already been scammed by fraudsters from victims based on statistics gathered from reported complaints of digital arrests alone

title: China reaffirms its territorial claims over Shaksgam Valley after India’s objections
content: Pakistan illegally ceded 5,180 sq km of Indian territory in the Shaksgam Valley to China in 1963 from areas illegally occupied by it

title: BJP complains to ECI over 'illegal' hoardings put up by NCP, other parties in Pune
content: In the run-up to the municipal corporation elections, the Nationalist Congress Party and other parties have put up unauthorised flex banners across the city. This amounts to a violation of the Model Code of Conduct, says Maharashtra BJP general secretary Rajesh Pande

title: Vance, Rubio congratulate Gor on assuming charge as U.S. envoy to India
content: Addressing U.S. Embassy personnel, Sergio Gor said no country is as essential as India for Washington, adding that both sides are actively engaged in firming up a trade deal.

title: Neighbours to depose as Kolkata Police investigates ED searches at I-PAC chief’s residence
content: “Police have decided to record the statements of Pratik Jain's neighbours to ascertain whether they witnessed any part of the searches or the manner in which the ED officials entered the building located on Loudon Street in Kolkata,” says official

title: Former MP Thomas Kuthiravattam from Kerala dies at 80
content: A native of Kallissery in Chengannur, he was a well-known face in Kerala politics and had a long association with Kerala Congress

title: Odisha moves to construct new Assembly building to double house capacity
content: An ultra-modern office campus which will house both State Secretariat and new Odisha Legislative Assembly building has been envisaged in line with the Central Vista project

title: BMC elections: the rise of fluid alliances | Explained
content: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation elections, scheduled for January 15, represent a high-stakes battle for control of India’s richest civic body. The city has turned into a contested battleground shaped by shifting coalitions, identity politics, and strategic alliances

title: Four students from State model schools nominated to ‘Sakura Science’ programme
content: The programme, implemented by Japan Science and Technology Agency (JST), invites outstanding high school students for a week and gives them an opportunity to witness and learn about advanced scientific technology and interact with the top scientists

title: Sabarimala gold theft case: High Court slams TDB, flays SIT for not arresting K.P. Sankara Das
content: A single Bench was hearing arguments by the prosecution that the gold plating of, among others, the door frames and that of the Dwarapalaka idols had been entrusted to him

title: Tourism and industrial fair opens at Island Grounds
content: The fair that has 43 stalls showcasing the projects and functioning of various State government departments and, corporations, also has attractions like giant wheel and 3D show

title: Punjab police claims cracking ex-sarpanch murder case
content: Jharmal Singh, a former sarpanch, was allegedly killed after being shot from point-blank range at a wedding venue in Amritsar

title: Presence of WB Govt and police officials during Mamata’s intervention of ED raid an ‘illegal act’, claims BJP
content: On January 8, West Bengal Chief Secretary and Kolkata Police Commissioner were present during the raids along with Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee

title: Omar Abdullah rebuffs BJP demand to set up National Law University in Jammu instead of Kashmir
content: The BJP demand is the latest in its campaign in Jammu after seeking cancellation of the MBBS selection list, which had 42 Muslims out of 50, at the Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Institute of Medical Excellence

title: Kashmiri Pandit leader Bhushan Bazaz, 91, an advocate of Hindu-Muslim unity, passes away in New Delhi
content: Bhushan Bazaz, son of popular Kashmiri writer Prem Nath Bazaz, was known for his efforts to establish peace in J&K through non-violent means

title: Himachal Govt sacks 11 cops for involvement in drug trade
content: “No one is above the law, and those who will promote the illegal trade of ‘chitta’ and other illegal drugs won’t be spared,” said CM Sukhvinder Sukhu

title: Concerns raised over continuing gaps in SIR process
content: People’s representatives seek steps to address issues related to SIR draft list, change of polling booths, and enrolment of new voters

title: In a first, Rajasthan panchayat gets certified for going fully organic
content: The panchayat took measures not only to resolve issues of soil degradation and declining groundwater level but also to address health concerns linked to chemical-based farming

title: Lucknow medical college staff seek FIR over vandalism, threaten to stall all OPD services
content: A scuffle broke out on the campus on January 9 when about 100 people, including BJP leader and vice-chairperson of the Uttar Pradesh Women’s Commission Aparna Yadav, allegedly tried to force their way into the Vice-Chancellor’s office

title: Medical college doctors defer their strike plans by a week following talks with govt.
content: The doctors had announced on Monday morning that academic activities in all government medical colleges across Kerala would grind to a halt from Tuesday

title: "Was Any Leader Jailed?" Asaduddin Owaisi Questions RSS' Role In Freedom
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has questioned the contribution of RSS in India's freedom struggle and alleged that Sangh founder K B Hedgewar was jailed not for opposing British rule but for supporting the 'Khilafat movement'.

title: PM Modi's Car Diplomacy Continues With German Chancellor Friedrich Merz Visit
content: Prime Minister Modi shared a picture on X of him riding in a car with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz, highlighting the growing friendship between India and Germany.

title: 28-Year-Old Man Slits Wrists, Jumps From 11th Floor Balcony In Ghaziabad
content: The police said no suicide note has been recovered so far, and the exact reason behind the suicide remains unclear.

title: Iranians Able To Make Some International Calls, Internet Blackout Continues
content: Mobile phones in Iran were able to call abroad Tuesday after a crackdown on nationwide protests in which the internet and international calls were cut.

title: On Camera, Skier And Dog Caught In Dangerous Avalanche, Escape Unharmed
content: The skier and her dog were skiing in the Pyrenees Mountains of Andorra, a small country located between France and Spain.

title: Why Greenland's Vast Natural Resources Won't Necessarily Translate Into Huge Profits
content: Greenlands natural resources minister, Naaja Nathanielsen, said in 2025 that she wanted mining to become a "very good, stable supplement" to the countrys overwhelming dependence on the fisheries industry.

title: "Unreasonable": Elon Musk On Apple's Deal To Use Google's Gemini For Siri
content: Elon Musks comment came after Google confirmed a multi-year agreement with Apple to provide Gemini models and cloud infrastructure for Apples future AI feature.

title: Iran Edges Closer To A Revolution That Would Reshape The World
content: As protesters pour into the streets of Iran night after night, leaders across the region and around the world are grappling with the possibility that the Islamic Republic could be overthrown.

title: Hyderabad Man Duped Of Rs 27 Lakh In Online Trading Scam
content: The victim was added to a WhatsApp group where several people, claiming to be experts and assuring high profit and quick return, convinced him to invest money.

title: 6 Bengaluru College Staff Suspended After Medical Student Dies By Suicide
content: Six faculty members of a dental college here have been suspended by the management pending further inquiry into the death of a 23-year-old student by suicide.

title: Taiwan Reaches 'General Consensus' With US On Trade Deal
content: Taiwan and the United States began negotiations in April to hash out a trade deal after US President Donald Trump slapped a 32% tariff on Taiwanese exports, which was later lowered to 20%, as part of his sweep of measures against trade partners.

title: Fath To Shahed: Iran Sent Missiles Worth $2.7 Billion To Russia In 4 Years
content: Iran has sold nearly $3 billion worth of missiles to Russia to aid President Vladimir Putin's nearly four-year-long war in Ukraine, according to an assessment from a Western security official.

title: Over 120 Andhra Youngsters Trapped In 'Cyber Slavery' In Myanmar Rescued
content: It was learnt that organised groups operating from Cambodia, Myanmar, Laos, and nearby countries were luring young Indians with fake job offers on social media and online platforms.

title: On Camera, Man Kidnaps 2 School Students, Gets Caught After Bike Crashes
content: A lunch break in a Karnataka government school turned into a human scavenger hunt after two students went missing on Monday. The children were traced after the man, who took them away on a motorcycle, met with an accident.

title: At 3 Degrees Celsius, Delhi Wakes Up To Coldest January Morning In 3 Years
content: Delhi recorded its coldest January morning in three years on Tuesday as the minimum temperature dropped to 3 degrees Celsius, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said.

title: Thackerays Step Up 'Rasmalai' Attack, Fire "Impotence" Jab At BJP Leaders
content: The Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena (UBT) has stepped up the attack on BJP leader K Annamalai and also questioned why the BJP in Maharashtra had not slammed his "anti-Maharashtra" remarks.

title: Ostriches, Stoics, Suspicions: What Back-to-Back PSLV Failure Means For ISRO
content: The PSLV-C62, carrying the EOS-N1 Earth-observation satellite and a cluster of commercial payloads, deviated from its planned path after "disturbances" at the end of the third stage.

title: All About Warrants Most Immigration Agents Use To Make Arrests
content: Typically, arrests carried out by Department of Homeland Security agencies are authorised by administrative warrants - sometimes known as immigration warrants - not judicial warrants.

title: US Lawmaker Introduces Bill For Greenland's 'Annexation And Statehood'
content: Republican Congressman Randy Fine has formally introduced the 'Greenland Annexation and Statehood Act', a legislation aimed at giving the Trump administration a legal authority to pursue annexation and eventual statehood for Greenland.

title: Row over CM’s mega quiz rages on
content: Organisations affiliated to the Opposition demand that it be withdrawn, citing political agenda behind holding the programme and that it would push the students to more hardship

title: Annual premium of over ₹1,200 crore for CMCHIS paid to insurance company
content: The amount of ₹1,237.80 crore comprised ₹1,173.66 crore towards 95% of the annual premium for the coverage period, benefitting 1,45,51,697 families, in addition to ₹64.13 crore being the remaining 5% premium from last year

title: China Communist Party team meets BJP leaders
content: The delegation will also meet a RSS delegation; meetings come after thaw in India-China ties in 2024, with Beijing resuming the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra and the reinstatement of direct flights between the two countries

title: Ex-refugee takes over as UNHCR chief
content: A former Iraqi president, Barham Salih, 65, became the first former head of state to run the United Nations High Commission for Refugees (UNHCR) at the start of the year

title: Supreme Court names new trial judge for coal scam cases
content: Incumbent Special CBI Judge Sanjay Bansal was to officiate from April 8, 2025, onwards for a period of six months only

title: Russia claims Oreshnik missile hit Ukrainian aviation plant
content: Moscow said it fired the Oreshnik in response to its allegations that Ukraine attempted to hit one of President Vladimir Putin’s residences in a drone strike

title: Conservancy workers end protest after 165 days, to get back their jobs under National Urban Livelihoods Mission
content: State governement assured the workers that nearly 1,400 of them would be reinstated under NULM with the Chennai Corporation. Six workers would be taken back at a later stage, as their health condition improves, said Uzhaippor Urimai Iyakkam.

title: Police conduct raids, destroy arenas to prevent rooster fights
content: Drones are being used to check illegal activities in remote villages and stern action will be taken against those who violate the orders, say police

title: India, Germany to simplify defence trade: PM Modi
content: India will launch a ‘consultation mechanism’ on increasing collaboration with Germany in the Indo-Pacific region, says Prime Minister Modi; Visa-free transit for Indian passport holders for transiting through Germany was also announced

title: Non-application of mind, ‘copy-paste’ order led to detention under NSA: Wangchuk in Supreme Court
content: Application of mind by the detaining authority should be independent of the material provided to it by the authorities proposing it, the climate activist’s counsel Kapil Sibal argues in the court

title: New South Wales University to open Bengaluru campus in August, at Manyata Tech Park
content: The University of New South Wales, one of Australia’s leading universities, will open its campus in Bengaluru at Manyata Tech Park in August, 2026

title: No receipts for SIR documents, Mamata writes fifth letter to CEC
content: In the letter, the Chief Minister also pointed out that many genuine voters are being categorised as “logical discrepancies” and called for hearings

title: Centre steps in as two Nipah cases detected in Bengal
content: Both patients are healthcare workers; West Bengal government asks people to not panic but stay alert and take precautions

title: Government disputes reports that it plans to ask phone makers to disclose source code
content: The reports, based on a 2023 cybersecurity standard put out by a body under the Department of Technology, were mischaracterising the government’s conversations with phone makers, says the IT Ministry

title: ‘Chaos may happen’ if Kuki-Zo MLAs join Manipur govt., says KZC chairman
content: Henlianthang Thanglet, chief of the conglomerate of Kuki-Zo bodies, said in an interview with The Hindu that it was the ten Kuki-Zo MLAs who first wrote to the Prime Minister for a separate administration; of the 10 MLAS, 7 belong to the BJP

title: Victim safety, sanctity of trial paramount to consider bail in POCSO cases: Supreme Court
content: The Bench held that the April 2025 order of the Allahabad High Court granting bail had resulted in a ‘miscarriage of justice’, as it failed to account for the threat to the victim’s safety

title: Reopening of Kamaraj Road brings relief, but commuters fear fresh traffic chaos on M.G. Road
content: Kamaraj Road was fully reopened on January 2, 2026, restoring the two-way traffic between Cubbon Road and MG Road.

title: PM Modi, German Chancellor Merz inaugurate International Kite Festival 2026 in Ahmedabad
content: PM and German Chancellor get grand welcome with music and dance performances; the leaders visit exhibit reflecting Ahmedabad’s architectural heritage, observe kite-making demonstrations

title: Bengaluru PG inspections reveal rampant rule violations; citizens call it ‘eyewash’
content: Inspections in C.V. Raman Nagar and Shanti Nagar found that all 321 establishments checked were flouting regulations

title: SAAP launches State Sports Calendar in Tirupati
content: Ravi Naidu says the calendar will provide advance clarity on competitions and training programmes, enabling sportspersons to plan systematically and boosting sports development across Andhra Pradesh

title: Notice to State government on PIL seeking 30 acre land for constructing new building for Karnataka High Court
content: The petitioner points out to the court that recently Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar has given a statement to the media that the government is identifying land for constructing a new building for the High Court

title: DTPC terminates workers’ contract after sewage disposal at Butt Road beach park
